page.title: 01Wildsworth and Surroundings
page.content: This block of land lies betwen the river Trent and Laughton. Running south to north in the west of the block is the trent, a tidal river used regularly by small coasters and barges. Most of the land is arable, very flat and low near to River level. Drainage and pumping are needed to prevent flooding. Crops are mostly cereal and root crops. There is no sign of livestock. The east side is coniferous forest for timber production. These are maintined by the forestry commission. The area is sparsely populated. Wildsworth village has less than 50 inhabitants. There are three farms with cottages nearby and other small cottage around the forest areas. Most residents in the area are local born and bred, although not all work the land, many have connections with farming
